A hospital can lose its reputation, good doctors and patients if it fails to provide good services.  In many ways, I believe that product liability lawsuits should be regulated heavily. For example, if a drug company follows all of the FDA's protocols in the development of a new drug and doesn't hide anything and the FDA approves the drug, liability should be extremely limited and directed towards the FDA. The same should hold true for automotive companies. If a vehicle is certified by the NHTSA, then the manufacturer shouldn't be held liable for unforeseen risks unless there is an unapproved change in the vehicle manufacturing process that wasn't certified.
